messages.content: what year did India win the cricket world cup in?

India won the Cricket World Cup in 1983 and 2011. The details are:

- 1983 Cricket World Cup: India won the final against West Indies at Lord's Cricket Ground in London. This was India's first ever World Cup win in cricket. Kapil Dev was the captain of the Indian team.

- 2011 Cricket World Cup: India won the final against Sri Lanka at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, India. This was India's second World Cup win in cricket. MS Dhoni was the captain of the Indian team.

So the years that India won the Cricket World Cup are 1983 and 2011. The 1983 World Cup win is considered a historic moment for Indian cricket as it was the first major international tournament India had won.

a cricket delivery that bounces twice before reaching the batsman, is it legal?

A cricket delivery that bounces twice before reaching the batsman is not legal and is called a double bounce delivery. The laws of cricket state that for a delivery to be fair, it must bounce only once before reaching the batsman. Some key points regarding double bounce deliveries:

• As per the laws of cricket, a double bounce delivery is considered a no ball, meaning the delivery is deemed invalid and the batsman cannot be out from it.

• The umpire will call a no ball for a double bounce delivery and signal it by raising both hands above the head.

• The bowler is warned by the umpire for bowling a double bounce delivery. Repeated double bounces can lead to the bowler being removed from the attack.

• A double bounce delivery can be dangerous for the batsman as it is unpredictable after the second bounce. This is why the law prohibits such deliveries.

• The sole exception is if the ball accidentally hits the sightscreen or an object in its path and then bounces twice before reaching the batsman. In this case, the delivery is considered fair.

So in summary, a cricket delivery that bounces twice before reaching the batsman is an illegal delivery, called a no ball, unless it hits an object on its path and then bounces twice. Hope this clarifies things! Let me know if you have any other questions.
